bill_title: establish a task force to study highway needs and financing of highway needs in the state and to declare an emergency.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to establish a task force to study highway needs and financing of highway needs in the state and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is established a task force to study highway needs and the financing of highway needs in the state. The task force shall investigate the current status, the safety, the expected life, and the needs of state, county, municipal, and township highways in the state, and the associated construction and maintenance costs related to those needs. The task force shall review the taxes and fees that have been implemented to fund these highway needs at the state, county, municipal, and township levels. The task force shall also consider the future potential and possible impacts of declining federal funds for highway construction. The task force shall make recommendations to the Legislature as to whether the taxes and fees that have been implemented are adequate to meet current and future highway needs or whether there needs to be changes to the system of funding highways needs in the state and, if so, what those changes should be. The task force shall make its recommendations to the Governor and the Legislature by November 15, 2008. Section 2. The task force shall consist of seventeen members. Ten of the task force members shall be members of the Legislature. Five members shall be current members of the Senate, with no more than three of the same political party, and five members shall be current members of the House of Representative, with no more than three of the same political party. The Executive Board of the Legislative Research Council shall appoint the members of the Legislature to serve on the task force by May 1, 2008. The Governor shall appoint the remaining members of the task force by May 1, 2008. Of the remaining members of the task force: one member shall represent the State Transportation Commission, one member shall represent the Department of Transportation, one member shall represent counties, one member shall represent municipalities, one member shall represent townships, one member shall represent highway contractors, and one member shall represent the business community in the state. Section 3. The task force shall be under the supervision of the Executive Board of the Legislative Research Council and staffed and funded as an interim legislative committee. The executive board shall appoint the chair and vice chair of the task force who shall be members of the Legislature. Section 4. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the support of the state government and its existing public institutions, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval.
